Title: Department of Energy/University research: A smart partnership for a smart grid
Venue: IEEE PES Power Systems Conference and Exposition
Abstract summary: The Department of Energy is partnering with universities to develop advanced analytical tools and applications for smart grid operations.

Title: 166 15091 – Smart Buildings and Smart Grids 5 . 9 Human Machine Interaction in Energy Informatics
Authors: H. Jacobsen, R. Katz, H. Schmeck, C. Goebel
Abstract summary: The paper discusses human-machine interaction in smart grid operations, which is relevant to the query.

Title: AAFGDES: A fuzzy expert system realization of Adaptive Autonomy using Gradient Descent
Authors: M. Zamani, A. Fereidunian, M.A.A. Akhoundi, H. Lesani
Abstract summary: A fuzzy expert system with gradient descent algorithm is used to determine the level of automation in human-automation interaction for smart grid operations.

Title: A New Model for Industry–University Partnerships
Abstract summary: This paper describes an industry-university partnership in the water industry, but does not address human-machine interaction in smart grid operations.

Title: A Survey on Human Machine Interaction in Industry 4.0
Authors: Christian Krupitzer, Sebastian Müller, Veronika Lesch, Marwin Züfle, Janick Edinger, Alexander Lemken, Dominik Schäfer, Samuel Kounev, C. Becker
Abstract summary: The paper surveys human-machine interaction in Industry 4.0, focusing on new paradigms that integrate augmented and virtual reality.

Title: Organizational aspects for successful integration of human-machine interaction in the industry 4.0 era
Abstract summary: The paper discusses organizational aspects for successful integration of human-machine interaction in Industry 4.0, but does not specifically address industry-university partnerships or smart grid operations.

Title: Cyber-Physical Security: A Game Theory Model of Humans Interacting Over Control Systems
Authors: S. Backhaus, R. Bent, J. Bono, Ritchie Lee, Brendan D. Tracey, D. Wolpert, Dongping Xie, Y. Yildiz
Abstract summary: The paper presents a game theory model to predict the interactions between intruders and system operators in smart grid cyber-physical security.

Title: A Human-Machine Reinforcement Learning Method for Cooperative Energy Management
Authors: Yuechuan Tao, Jing Qiu, Shuying Lai, Xian Zhang, Yunqi Wang, Guibin Wang
Abstract summary: A human-machine reinforcement learning framework for cooperative energy management in smart grids.
